title: 1920s “Red Hot” Dance Moves?
self_text: I was watching a movie with lots of dancing, and the women were doing these very fast, lively dance moves—very different from what I usually see in older movies (e.g., Charleston).  I’m wondering if there was an actual dance called “Red Hot” back then, or something similar that was popular at the time?   If so, could you describe it?   Do you have any photos/videos to show me?

title: My brother is not Muslim, why does he feel like I’m judging him for his religious beliefs?
self_text: Hi everyone, so my brother has been very hostile to me ever since I said that “I don’t get the point of a religion” because it seems to control your life and all these weird rules that you can’t break.   He says that I am being judgemental, but I was just trying to explain what I didn’t understand. He even went on to say that Islam is peaceful and that it’s wrong to judge people based on their religion.   However, he keeps bringing up the fact that he is Muslim. Like, why would he be offended by something I said about his religion? I think it’s fair to question things you don't understand. If it makes sense, then I have no issue with him believing in it, but if it doesn’t make sense, why do I have to pretend that I agree with everything he says? He said that I should not talk about his religion when he is around because it is rude. Is this true or just an excuse to try and get me to stop questioning him?   I’m wondering why he is so angry at me for saying this. Is he feeling judged or is he just making me feel guilty for asking questions? And more importantly, why does it seem like he is making me feel bad for simply questioning his belief system?

title: Does anyone else think that the ending of Fire & Blood is a lie?
self_text: I just finished reading it and I have so many questions, especially about what happened to Aegon. Was he really killed by Rhaenyra? I don’t believe she would let him live because of how much she hated him for being born. So why did she allow him to be killed? It feels like a big plot hole. Plus, I'm not sure if they ever found out that his body was poisoned. If not, then how could they know it was Rhaenyra who ordered it?  I also feel like they were trying to make her look good, but all I see is someone who has no control over her emotions. She allowed herself to get too angry and she ended up killing her own son!   Do you guys think she should have been banished or killed? I feel like she deserved both. But the fact that she got away with it... I can't wrap my head around it. It feels like an injustice.

title: Did Dr. Chris ever say the words “I’m sorry” to Kim?
self_text: I just watched an episode of 90 Day Fiancé: Happily Ever After and it got me thinking. In the episode where they were fighting about him not wanting to move to the US, he said, “Don’t apologize for being you.”  Later in the episode, after she was crying about how hurt she felt and he said, "I'm so sorry."  Did he ever say that to her during their whole relationship?   It seemed like he kept telling her not to be upset, but never actually said he was sorry.  Thoughts?

title: The 10 commandments are not written in stone
self_text: Many people believe that the 10 commandments were written on stone tablets, but there is no historical evidence to support this claim. They were written by God himself and given to Moses. They were written on parchment or papyrus scrolls, as it was the most common writing material at the time. So why does everyone believe they were written in stone? It's because of a misinterpretation of the Hebrew word “stone”. The Hebrew word for stone is “ezer”, which also means "rock" or "foundation". In the Old Testament, "ezer" refers to God’s strength and foundation. But when we read the Bible, we should understand it in its original context.   So what do you think? Do you believe the 10 commandments were written on stone?

title: Is it possible to get a divorce if you’re not religious?
self_text: I am Catholic and my husband is not. He doesn't believe in God or any religion at all. We have been married for a few years now and we are living together, but I feel like he is unhappy because of our differences. I would love to be able to start over with someone who shares the same values as me, which is very important to me. The thing is that my parents said that if I want to end the marriage then I need to go through the process of annulment. However, my mother also stated that “we can get divorced” even though she didn’t explain how. She just says that we can do it.  I looked up some information on annulments and they seem pretty complicated. It may take several months and a lot of money. So, what exactly does annulment mean when you are not religious? Is there any other way? Can a non-religious person get a divorce?   Thank you for your time.

title: I’m not sure if I need to see a therapist or not…
self_text: Okay, so I was raised by my grandparents since my parents were killed in an accident when I was 3. My grandparents are very religious and taught me everything they know about Christianity.   I have been going to church with them ever since.   When I turned 18, my grandparents decided that it would be best for me to find my own church but they said I could go to theirs whenever I wanted to.   So I went to their church on Sunday, where the pastor gave a sermon about how God is angry at people who worship other gods (like Satan). He said that if you worship other gods, then God will punish you forever.  My grandparents told me that I needed to repent because I had been worshiping Satan for 6 years.  They also said that if I didn't repent, I would burn in hellfire forever.   I am not sure what to do here. I don’t think I’ve been worshipping any god, let alone Satan.  I just don’t like the idea of worshipping anyone because it feels fake and meaningless.  I’ve never felt that way about God.   I’m wondering if maybe I should see a therapist to talk about this.   What do you guys think? Do I need to see a therapist?   Thank you!

title: What do you think about the new Netflix series “The Witcher”?
self_text: I’m a big fan of The Witcher books, so I was really excited for this adaptation. And while it has a lot of good points, it also seems to be taking some liberties with the source material.  I know that shows often change things, but many of these changes seem pretty drastic and unnecessary. For example, in the show they gave Ciri a much darker backstory than she had in the books. She doesn't have as much of a connection to Yennefer, which is one of my favorite aspects of the character from the books. I’m curious what other changes they made.   What are your thoughts on the show? Did it live up to expectations?

title: What did the Prophet Muhammad say about his death?
self_text: The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) said, “My death will happen and that of my right-hand man, Ali ibn Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with them both, will happen in Medina. Then we will return to God.”   This prophecy came true.  The Prophet died in Medina.   However, Ali ibn Abi Talib did not die in Medina. He died in Kufa.  So, why did it come true that the Prophet’s death happened in Medina, but not Ali’s?   It is reported in books such as Sahih Muslim that the Prophet made a distinction between his death and the death of Ali ibn Abi Talib.  He said that he would die in Medina, and Ali would return to God after he was gone.   I found out that there are different interpretations of the hadith about the Prophet's death. Some scholars believe that the Prophet was referring to a return to God after his physical death, whereas others believe that he was referring to a return to God during his lifetime.   Can you please explain to me what the correct interpretation of the hadith is?

title: My life has become a nightmare... please help!
self_text: I'm not even sure where to start.  I'm an extremely devout Christian, and have been my whole life. I was raised in a very strict church where we were taught that if you weren't saved by accepting Jesus as your Lord and Savior at a young age (like around 8-12), then you would go to hell.   When I was 12, my family moved to Spain. The Spanish church is very different than the American church.  The priest there basically said that it doesn't matter what you do for the rest of your life, once you die, if you haven't accepted Jesus as your lord and savior, then you will burn in hell forever. He didn't say anything about grace or forgiveness.   My parents are religious, but they don't preach all the time like the Americans did. They're more relaxed, but they still push that it matters.   So anyway, when I got to college, I started questioning everything. I had always been afraid of dying, because I thought I would go to hell. But now, the idea of being punished for eternity just seemed so ridiculous. I started reading the Bible and trying to figure out how Christianity fit into reality. I came across some things that made me think that maybe God isn't the angry judge that people make him out to be.  I started praying to God asking for guidance.  And then he told me to start taking medicine, that I needed to see a psychiatrist.  I went to the doctor and took my meds, and things have gotten worse since. It feels like the devil is telling me that I need to take medicine so I can stop believing in God.  It feels like he wants to trick me.    I've been praying to God, begging him for answers.  He keeps telling me to trust the process and that my life is going to get better.  But how can I? I feel like I'm losing my mind.

title: What if the teachings of Islam were to be accepted by Christians?
self_text: Many Christians have wondered what it would look like if Christianity and Islam were merged into a single religion, so I thought I'd explore that idea on here.  Muslims believe Jesus was a prophet of God, just like Muhammad. Muslims also believe in the Quran, which is seen as God’s word for mankind. The problem is that many Christians do not accept Islam because they believe Islam has changed the original teachings of Christianity. They also reject the belief of Muhammad being a prophet because he isn’t seen as having been blessed with divine revelations.   I could see how Muslims could say that Christianity has changed over time too.  Many people are also confused about the concept of “shirk” (associating partners with God). However, the way shirk is interpreted by many Christians can be seen as something similar to idolatry.

Thanks in advance.

title: I have a question about the "last judgement"
self_text: I was reading about the “Last Judgement” and how people will be judged by Christ in Heaven.  I was thinking if he is God then why would he need to judge us?  If he is all knowing, that means he knows everything about everyone. So it seems like it’s already decided who goes to heaven and who goes to hell.   Does anyone know what the answer to this question is?

title: What is the first thing you ever did with your wife?
self_text: As a child, my dad was always teaching me how to do something new and my mom would be there too. I remember them telling me about all their experiences together which really made me feel like they were partners. I've never had an experience of that sort so I'm wondering if anyone else can tell me what the first thing they ever did with their wife was? It doesn't have to be romantic at all!

title: I’m an atheist with a Muslim family… what should I do?
self_text: So I was raised by a Muslim family and am pretty sure my parents are hardcore Muslims.  I don’t believe in any religion, but they really want me to convert.   They keep saying that the Quran is the word of God and that if you believe it, you will be happy.   I understand they have been through a lot, so I’m not trying to be rude or disrespect them.  However, I’d like to know if there’s anything I can say to convince them that their beliefs aren’t true without getting into a big fight.   I also need help figuring out how to deal with this situation overall.   How do I reconcile being part of a culture and family that wants something different from me than I want?   Do I even want to stay with them?  What am I supposed to do?

title: Say something nice about the Muslim community
self_text: I'm just trying to get some positive vibes going on here. It feels like there is so much hate out in the world, and it can be hard to find good people.   I know that the Muslim community has had a rough time lately because of the recent events with Islamophobia, and it makes me sad seeing all of this negativity.  It doesn't mean they are all bad people though. They have their own rules and traditions that we don't understand. Maybe if people took the time to learn more about them, they would see that most of them aren't looking for trouble.   Just saying something nice or positive is great to see.   Thank you for your time!

title: Is there any way to get rid of the old school connection?
self_text: I have a PC that is older and it doesn't have a connection to my new gaming console.

title: Is it possible to have a child with both Jewish and Muslim heritage?
self_text: My husband is Jewish, but his mother converted to Islam when she married my father. I am Muslim, but my mother converted to Christianity when she married my father. Does that mean that our children will be raised in two religions or just one?

title: What if the entire last season of Game of Thrones was a dream?
self_text: I’ve been thinking about it ever since the finale aired and what if everything that happened in the last 6 episodes was just a dream? Like, maybe Bran was dreaming the whole time and he was trying to protect himself from whatever horrible thing he was experiencing. I think it would make so much more sense because, like, the ending made no sense. I know people are saying that Daenerys was right to do what she did but I still don't understand how they got to King's Landing. It feels as though the writers were trying to force her to kill all those people or something. And then at the end, when everyone said “we’re safe” and they were all smiling…I thought that wasn’t actually real.  What if it was just his dream?

title: My sister's boyfriend said he was Muslim, and I felt a strange sense of peace…
self_text: It’s probably just because I’m feeling really bad about my current situation, but it happened when we were driving home from dinner last night. He was talking about his faith, how important family is to him, and how he tries to be a good person in the world.  I felt this odd sensation of calm wash over me. Like all my anxiety and stress just vanished.   It made me think maybe I should look into Islam more seriously. Does anyone have any recommendations for beginners?

title: Does any of the teachers from Love is Blind have a Muslim background?
self_text: I'm not sure, but it seems like most of them are Christian or Jewish.   I just saw that Patrick and his girlfriend were having an argument about if he was going to attend the Catholic Church on Sunday.  It's just funny because you know he's trying to get her to convert so she can be with him forever... but she doesn't want to!  What do you guys think?

title: Is there a way to get the blessings of Allah on your home?
self_text: I was reading an article about Muslims praying for their homes, and how they believe it will bring blessings and safety. The article talked about making a dua for your home.   I am not Muslim, so I don’t know much about Islam.   Can anyone tell me if there are any ways to get the blessings of Allah on your home?

title: How to use the term “unseen” in the context of a religious argument?
self_text: I was arguing with my friend about Islam and their belief that there are unseen things like angels, devils etc.   I tried to make an analogy and used the word “unseen”.   I wanted to know how it is actually used in the context of a religious argument. Is it something they just say or do they really believe that certain things exist that cannot be observed by humans?   I’m interested in learning more about this topic.

title: Is it possible to be born Muslim, raised Christian and still have a connection with Allah?
self_text: I was born in a Christian household but my mother converted to Islam when she was young.  My father didn't like the idea so he raised me as a Christian.   Now that my mother has passed away and I've been talking to her brother, who is a devout muslim, I feel a pull towards Islam. I’m not sure if it's just because I'm grieving or something, but I feel like there might be more to life than what I was taught growing up.  I have no intention of converting but I would really love to learn more about Islam.  Does anyone think it's possible to have a connection with Allah even if you were raised as a Christian? Does faith need to be inherited or can you develop it yourself?

title: What’s the best way to get rid of a nasty headache?
self_text: I had a really bad headache yesterday and took some ibuprofen but it didn't really help. I ended up taking 2x the amount I was supposed to take because it felt like nothing was working, so that's not ideal. Today my head is still feeling a bit sore. Is there any natural remedies for headaches or should I just stick with taking ibuprofen?

title: Any Muslims or former Muslims who have become Christian?
self_text: I'm interested to know how a Muslim who has been raised in Islam decided to convert to Christianity.  Did you ever pray before converting? How did you learn about Christianity? What was the process like? And any tips for someone who wants to convert from Islam to Christianity?   I'm asking because I am a Muslim and I want to be Christian, but it is difficult because my parents are Islamic.  Thank you!

title: Is there a way to convert a .wav file to an mp3 on the PS5?
self_text: I'm trying to transfer music files from my phone to my PS5, and it only accepts MP3 files.  I have been able to download all of my music through Spotify, but it doesn't support any other file types.  Is there a way to convert the .wav files into MP3s without using a computer?  And if so, is that possible on the PS5?

title: Is there any way to get rid of my OCD?
self_text: I have been dealing with a lot of OCD and anxiety lately, and it's really messing up my life. It's caused me to drop out of college because of how much time it takes for me to just do simple things like get ready in the morning. My parents don't understand or care about what I am going through either, so I feel like I am on my own. I know that therapy is an option, but it can be expensive and hard to find someone you trust.  I have tried different meds and they didn't help at all, so I am starting to think I am stuck with this for the rest of my life. What do you guys think? Are there any ways to get rid of OCD without medication? Any advice would be appreciated.

title: [Spoilers] What if the last chapter was a dream?
self_text: I know that’s a common theory, but it still doesn’t feel right to me. The way the movie ends is so perfect and hopeful, with everything working out for everyone. It just feels too good to be true.  I also think that the final shot of “The End” is an obvious sign.  It’s a reference to the ending of the book, where Harry says “The end.”   It makes you question what’s real.  Maybe the whole thing was a dream, or something like that.

title: Hello, I'm new here…
self_text: Hello everyone!  I recently got a new phone and wanted to download a few games but my phone isn't that powerful so I am wondering which ones you guys recommend?  Thank you!

title: Can you get a teaching degree with a religious exemption?
self_text: I’m considering getting a teaching degree in the state of Pennsylvania and I have some religious objections to my classes being taught by someone who doesn’t share my faith. Does it matter if I don’t want to teach anyone that is not Christian?  I am worried about having to “teach” people things I believe are immoral or sinful, such as evolution.  Is there any way around that?  Thank you for your time!

title: Does anyone know where I can get a religious education in the area?
self_text: Hello,  I'm looking for a good Catholic school near me and any other religious education that is available around here.   If you could provide some information about these schools, it would be very helpful! Thank you.

title: Game of Thrones - Religious Diversity
self_text: I recently re-watched Game of Thrones and a few things struck me as odd. The religious diversity of Westeros is very low, which makes sense given how isolated the regions are. However, what about the smaller religions? Are there any cults or minor religions in the world? For example, did the people worship the Old Gods before they were persecuted by the First Men? Were there any other gods that had been forgotten?   I’m just curious if the religion was limited to the Seven Kingdoms.

title: Is it possible to feel the presence of God?
self_text: I was talking to my friend about spirituality and he said something that made me think. He said that we can't fully understand what God is like because we are limited beings, but if we allow ourselves to be open and humble we can feel his presence.  I have been praying for a while now and I always feel an overwhelming sense of peace and love when I do. It feels as though someone or something is watching over me. I don’t know if that’s just my imagination, but it makes me wonder if that’s actually God.   What do you guys think? Have you ever felt His presence? If so how did it make you feel?

title: Do you think the prophecies of Revelation are literal?
self_text: I was reading through the book of Revelation, and it seemed like a lot of things were to be taken literally. It's not just about Christians that believe in Jesus, but also about Jewish people, too! So did God have a plan for them? Do you think we will see a Messiah or Christ-like figure come into existence soon?

title: Die Hard, Die Harder and Die Hardest… a question for the fans!
self_text: I love the die hard franchise but am wondering which film is best overall?  Die Hard (1988) or Die Harder (1995)?  I can't seem to make up my mind as they both have their strengths and weaknesses… especially with the latter being more violent and having a bigger budget than the original.

title: Is it worth buying a PC to play Minecraft?
self_text: I’m wondering if it’s worth buying a PC for Minecraft. For the time being, I can only run Minecraft on my phone and it’s a little laggy at times. My brother has an iPad Air and he runs it pretty smoothly too. But I was thinking of getting a PC with a dedicated graphics card so that I could play it better. What are some good PCs that you would recommend for playing Minecraft? And what is the best graphics card to get?

title: Can I get a refund on my new build?
self_text: Hello everyone, just bought a new PC and it's not working at all. It won't turn on.  I've done everything the tech support has said to do but nothing is working. They keep saying that there isn't anything they can do. The system will not boot up. There are no lights or sounds. Not even a blink of light.   The only thing I did was buy a brand new build from Best Buy.  They offered me store credit. I don't want store credit. I want a full refund. I think Best Buy is scamming people and offering store credit instead of refunds. Is that true? How can I get a full refund from them? Any advice? Thank you!

title: What if I had a Christian family and went to church?
self_text: I've been raised in a Jewish household, but my mom is Christian so I attend church with her every Sunday. It’s always been something that feels weird to me because it just doesn’t make sense. If Jesus died for our sins, why do we need to go to church? It just seems like a waste of time. I love my mom and I don’t want to hurt her feelings by saying this, but I wanted to get some opinions on what other people think about the Bible.

title: My wife is converting to Islam and I’m trying to understand it better…
self_text: My wife is converting to Islam and I’m trying to understand it better, so she can tell me what her faith means to her. I was hoping you could help with that.

self_text: I was reading this book and it’s really good. I just want to know if anyone has read this before, or any other books like this?

title: Is it possible to become a Christian with no prior knowledge of the Bible?
self_text: I was raised Jewish and never had any exposure to Christianity or the bible until recently. After talking to my friend, he told me about Jesus and that if you accept him as your Lord and Savior you will go to heaven. He also said that the only way to get into heaven is by accepting Jesus as your lord and savior. I am trying to understand what this means. I've been reading the Bible but don't know where to start.

title: Is there any way to get a gift card from an online store for the Xbox Series S?
self_text: Hi, I was wondering if anyone knows how to get a gift card that can be used on the Xbox website. All the people at GameStop and Best Buy were telling me I couldn’t use them, but then I found some people online saying you could. Any tips or tricks?

title: Should a Muslim convert be allowed to marry a non-Muslim woman?
self_text: I'm not saying it is wrong but some people say that marrying a non-Muslim woman is haram (forbidden) and if they get married, then the Muslim man should convert her to Islam. Is that true?  I understand why you want your partner to be Muslim because of the afterlife. But what about the earthly part? Do you think there are any rules in Islam regarding this topic? What if she doesn't want to convert?

title: Is there a way to change the sound on my Xbox series X?
self_text: I was playing Halo Infinite and got really annoyed by how loud it was, so I turned down the volume to zero. Now I can't turn it up, either.  I tried changing the volume back to normal but nothing happens, just stays at zero. I'm not sure if I should reinstall the game or what to do.

title: Does anyone know the exact release date for the next chapter of The Silent Sister?
self_text: I'm looking to buy a copy and would like to know when it will be available in English.  It was released on April 20th, 2024 in Korea, but there hasn't been any information about an English translation coming out yet.   Any help would be greatly appreciated!

title: Does anyone feel like the ending of The Last Sentinel was a letdown?
self_text: Sorry for such a long question, but I just finished it and wanted to get other people’s opinions.  The whole movie was building up to the final confrontation between Chris & Mike.   Chris felt like he could die in peace because of Mike’s love for him.   However, after they finally killed Mike, Chris turned around and said “Mike’s love gave me the courage to do what I had to do” or something along those lines.   That did not make sense to me at all because I thought it would be more meaningful if he simply said that he felt like he did it for Mike.   I guess I am just expecting too much from an action movie… What do you guys think about it?

title: What is the meaning of “Blessed Be The Name” and why does it matter?
self_text: I have been researching about the Islamic prophet Muhammad and his followers, and some people are saying that the phrase “Blessed be the name” (Arabic: سبحان الله‎, Șabħan Allāh) is a mantra used by the Shi’a Muslims during their prayers and rituals to express praise for Allah, God.   I have also read in some sources that the phrase is used as an invocation or protection against evil spirits when encountering dangerous situations such as being attacked or trapped in a burning building.  Some scholars claim that the phrase was originally intended to be uttered only in moments of life-threatening situations. However, many people use the phrase at all times and in any circumstances.   I am wondering what the actual meaning of the phrase is and why it matters to them. Is it just a beautiful expression of gratitude towards Allah, or does it hold a deeper significance? Also, how did it become associated with protection from evil spirits?

title: My wife is converting to Islam.
self_text: I'm a Jewish man, and my wife is converting to Islam. We are currently in the process of learning about each other's religions and cultures. I am nervous about the changes she will be making, but also excited for her.   I want to support her decision, however I’m not sure how to do that.  I have a couple questions. First, what does a Muslim woman wear? Is there a specific kind of clothing they must wear when they go out or pray? Second, what does a Muslim woman need to know to be a good wife?

title: What if a Christian is attacked in a country where there are many Muslims?
self_text: This came up during a conversation with my friend and I realized that it would be incredibly difficult for the police to help him as they may see his religion as an attack on their faith.

title: What if the Last Days Were Today?
self_text: I’ve been praying for a long time, and it’s starting to feel like it won’t happen anymore.  I know that God will do what he wants to do with us, but my heart is just heavy.  If the last days were today, how would I spend my time?  What would you do on your final day? Would you be trying to find God or something more?
